description.narrative: Output 2.1 (CRC based legislations & policies): By 2020, the social sector institutions will have effective tools and mechanisms with which to coordinate and evaluate the comprehensive protection system, including violence prevention and reduction, the prevention of institutionalization, and the protection of children in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2 (Comprehensive Protection): By 2020, children and adolescents will have a comprehensive system for protecting their rights plus comprehensive protection and violence reduction policies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1 (CRC based legislations & policies): By 2020, the social sector institutions will have effective tools and mechanisms with which to coordinate and evaluate the comprehensive protection system, including violence prevention and reduction, the prevention of institutionalization, and the protection of children in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: A legal framework for the comprehensive protection of children remains as an important milestone yet to be achieved. The new national President stated that early childhood will be their governmental priority, and the new Minister of Social Development requested PCO´s assistance to refine a draft ECD law. PCO convened technical staff from ministries of education, health, social development and the Secretary of Childhood and Adolescence to develop a shared understanding of ECD governance. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2020

title.narrative: Proposal for a ECD comprehensive policy is under review by the National Assembly
